storyTitle: As Schedule Manager, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve formal approval before implementation

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission
preconditions: User is logged in as a Schedule Manager with valid credentials
User has authorization to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
At least one supported file type is available for attachment (PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX)
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change submission page from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked (asterisk or 'required' label), attachment section is visible, and submit button is present

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory fields with valid data: Schedule ID, Change Type, Effective Date, Reason for Change, Impact Description, and any other required fields
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept the input without errors, no validation warnings are displayed, field formatting is applied correctly (dates, text limits)

steps.action: Click on the attachment section and select one or more files with allowed file types (PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX) within the size limit
steps.expectedResult: Files are successfully attached, file names are displayed in the attachment section, file size is shown, no validation errors appear

steps.action: Review all entered information and click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the submission, loading indicator appears briefly, request is accepted and saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table

steps.action: Observe the system response after submission
steps.expectedResult: Approval workflow is automatically initiated, confirmation message is displayed with a unique request tracking ID (e.g., 'Request #SCR-2024-001 submitted successfully'), success notification appears on screen

steps.action: Note the tracking ID and verify it can be used for future reference
steps.expectedResult: Tracking ID is clearly visible and can be copied, user is redirected to confirmation page or dashboard showing the newly submitted request

postconditions: Schedule change request is stored in the database with status 'Pending'
Approval workflow is initiated and assigned to appropriate approvers
Request tracking ID is generated and associated with the submission
Notification is sent to approvers about the new request
User can view the submitted request in their submission history
Attached documents are stored securely and linked to the request

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: User is logged in as a Schedule Manager with valid credentials
User has authorization to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
Form validation rules are configured and active

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change submission page from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked with asterisks or 'required' labels

steps.action: Fill in only some of the mandatory fields, intentionally leaving one or more required fields empty (e.g., leave 'Reason for Change' blank)
steps.expectedResult: Filled fields accept the input, empty mandatory fields remain blank without triggering immediate validation

steps.action: Attempt to click the 'Submit' button without completing all mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and prevented from processing, form does not submit to the server

steps.action: Observe the validation error messages displayed on the form
steps.expectedResult: Clear error messages appear next to or above each missing mandatory field (e.g., 'Reason for Change is required'), empty fields are highlighted in red or with error styling, error summary may appear at the top of the form listing all validation issues

steps.action: Attempt to navigate away from the page or refresh
steps.expectedResult: System may display a warning that unsaved changes will be lost, no partial submission is created in the database

steps.action: Fill in the previously missing mandatory fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: Error messages disappear as fields are completed, field highlighting returns to normal state, submit button becomes enabled or validation passes

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button after all mandatory fields are completed
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully, confirmation message with tracking ID is displayed

postconditions: No incomplete request is saved to the database during failed submission attempts
User remains on the submission form with entered data preserved
After successful completion, request is submitted and workflow is initiated
Validation rules are confirmed to be working correctly

testCases.title: Test attachment validation for unsupported file types
preconditions: User is logged in as a Schedule Manager with valid credentials
User has authorization to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
Test files with unsupported formats are available (e.g., .exe, .bat, .zip, .rar)
Test files with supported formats are available (e.g., .pdf, .doc, .docx, .xls, .xlsx)
File type validation rules are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change submission page and locate the attachment section
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with attachment section visible, allowed file types and size limits are indicated (e.g., 'Supported formats: PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX. Max size: 10MB')

steps.action: Click on the attachment button and select a file with an unsupported format (e.g., .exe, .bat, .zip, or .rar file)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the unsupported file type immediately

steps.action: Observe the validation response from the system
steps.expectedResult: Clear validation error message is displayed (e.g., 'File type .exe is not supported. Please upload PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, or XLSX files only'), file is not added to the attachment list, error styling appears in the attachment section

steps.action: Attempt to attach multiple unsupported file types simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: All unsupported files are rejected with individual or grouped error messages, no unsupported files appear in the attachment list

steps.action: Remove the unsupported file attempt and click the attachment button again
steps.expectedResult: Error messages clear, attachment section returns to normal state ready for new file selection

steps.action: Select and attach files with supported formats (e.g., .pdf, .docx, .xlsx) within the size limit
steps.expectedResult: Files are successfully attached without any errors, file names and sizes are displayed in the attachment section, no validation error messages appear, files are ready for submission

steps.action: Complete all mandatory fields and submit the form with the valid attachments
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully with the supported file attachments, confirmation message with tracking ID is displayed

postconditions: Only files with supported formats are attached to the request
Unsupported files are rejected and not stored in the system
Request is submitted successfully with valid attachments
File validation rules are confirmed to be working correctly
Attached files are securely stored and linked to the request

storyTitle: As Schedule Manager, I want to track the status of my schedule change requests to stay informed of approval progress

testCases.title: Verify schedule change request status is displayed correctly
preconditions: User is logged in as a Schedule Manager with valid credentials
User has previously submitted at least one schedule change request
Status dashboard is accessible to the user
At least one request has undergone a status change (e.g., from Pending to Approved or Rejected)
Notification system is configured and operational
Database contains approval decisions and comments for at least one request

steps.action: Login to the system using valid Schedule Manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the main dashboard or home page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request status dashboard from the main menu or navigation bar
steps.expectedResult: Status dashboard page loads successfully, list of all submitted schedule change requests is displayed in a table or card format

steps.action: Observe the displayed information for each request in the list
steps.expectedResult: Each request shows: Request ID/Tracking Number, Submission Date, Change Type, Current Status (Pending, Approved, Rejected, Modification Requested) with appropriate visual indicators (colors, icons), and brief description or title

steps.action: Verify that status indicators are clearly visible and distinguishable
steps.expectedResult: Status indicators use distinct colors or icons (e.g., yellow/orange for Pending, green for Approved, red for Rejected, blue for Modification Requested), status labels are clearly readable

steps.action: Select a specific request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view of the selected request opens, showing comprehensive information including all submitted details, current status, and history section

steps.action: Review the detailed history section of the selected request
steps.expectedResult: Complete chronological history is displayed showing: Initial submission timestamp, all status changes with dates and times, approver names or roles for each decision, comments or feedback from approvers, modification requests if any, and any attached documents or responses

steps.action: Verify that all approval decisions are visible with associated comments
steps.expectedResult: Each approval decision shows: Decision maker's name, Decision date and time, Decision type (Approved/Rejected/Modification Requested), detailed comments or reasons for the decision, and any action items or next steps

steps.action: Trigger a status change on one of the requests (if test environment allows) or wait for a scheduled status change notification
steps.expectedResult: System detects the status change in real-time or near real-time (within acceptable polling interval)

steps.action: Observe the notification mechanism when status changes
steps.expectedResult: Notification is displayed promptly through one or more channels: In-app notification banner or popup, email notification to registered email address, notification badge on dashboard icon, notification includes request ID, old status, new status, and timestamp

steps.action: Refresh the status dashboard page
steps.expectedResult: Updated status is reflected immediately, request list shows the new status, notification counter updates if applicable

postconditions: User has successfully viewed all submitted requests and their statuses
Detailed history and comments are accessible for each request
Notification system has been verified to work correctly
Status updates are confirmed to be real-time or near real-time
User remains logged in and can continue to monitor requests
No data inconsistencies are observed between list view and detail view

testCases.title: Test filtering and searching of schedule change requests
preconditions: User is logged in as a Schedule Manager with valid credentials
User has submitted multiple schedule change requests with varying statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected, Modification Requested)
Requests have different submission dates spanning multiple days or weeks
Status dashboard is accessible with filter and search functionality enabled
At least 5-10 requests exist to effectively test filtering and searching

steps.action: Login to the system and navigate to the schedule change request status dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Status dashboard loads successfully displaying the complete list of all submitted schedule change requests without any filters applied

steps.action: Locate the filter controls on the dashboard (typically at the top or side of the request list)
steps.expectedResult: Filter section is visible with options for: Status filter (dropdown or checkboxes for Pending, Approved, Rejected, Modification Requested), Date range filter (from date and to date pickers), and possibly additional filters like Change Type or Priority

steps.action: Select a specific status from the status filter (e.g., select 'Approved' only)
steps.expectedResult: Request list immediately updates to show only requests with 'Approved' status, all other status requests are hidden from view, count or summary shows number of filtered results

steps.action: Verify that the filtered results match the selected criteria
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests show 'Approved' status, no requests with other statuses are visible, request count matches the number of approved requests

steps.action: Add a date range filter by selecting a start date and end date
steps.expectedResult: Request list further filters to show only approved requests submitted within the selected date range, requests outside the date range are excluded, multiple filters work together correctly (AND logic)

steps.action: Clear the status filter while keeping the date filter active
steps.expectedResult: Request list updates to show all requests (regardless of status) within the selected date range, filter controls reflect the current active filters

steps.action: Clear all filters by clicking 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: All filters are removed, complete list of all requests is displayed again, filter controls return to default state

steps.action: Locate the search functionality (search box or search field) on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Search box is visible and accessible, placeholder text indicates search capability (e.g., 'Search by Request ID')

steps.action: Enter a specific request ID or tracking number in the search box
steps.expectedResult: Search executes automatically (as you type) or after clicking search button, request list filters to show only the matching request

steps.action: Verify the search result displays the correct request
steps.expectedResult: Only the request matching the entered ID is displayed, all request details are correct and match the search criteria, if no match is found, appropriate 'No results found' message is displayed

steps.action: Clear the search box and test searching with partial request ID or keywords
steps.expectedResult: Search supports partial matching, all requests containing the search term are displayed, search is case-insensitive

steps.action: Combine search with filters by entering a search term and applying a status filter
steps.expectedResult: Results show requests that match both the search term AND the selected filter criteria, combined filtering works correctly without conflicts

steps.action: Clear all search terms and filters to return to the full list view
steps.expectedResult: Complete unfiltered list of all requests is displayed, all controls are reset to default state

postconditions: User has successfully tested all filtering options
Search functionality is confirmed to work with exact and partial matches
Combined filters and search work together correctly
Dashboard returns to unfiltered state showing all requests
No performance issues observed during filtering or searching
Filter and search states can be cleared and reset properly
